4.text:
I'm Andrew Smyth and 
my grandfather was Jackie Smyth

8.text:
who was awarded the VC [Victoria Cross]
in the First World War

12.text: in the action in France with the Sikhs

16.text:
who went forward to try to bring ammunitions
to the forward line.

21.text:
The action in which my grandfather 
won the Victoria Cross

25.text: was where the British had moved forward.

28.text:
There was trench-to-trench warfare 
with the Germans

32.text:
and the British had managed to take 
a piece of the German trenches.

37.text:
It was about 200 metres away 
over fairly open ground.

40.text:
And, of course, to hold the trench they needed
more ammunition... bombs, basically.

47.text:
And so volunteers were asked to come forward.
And one group went forward.

51.text:
And, of course, going across this open ground
they were all mown down

55.text:
in full view of the others that were in the
British trenches.

60.text: And then that happened a second time.

62.text:
And then my grandfather was asked whether
he could go and make an attempt.

68.text:
And he was instructed that no one should be
asked to go, they had to volunteer.

74.text: And the way the story's been told,

77.text:
and this underlines the bravery of the men
that were with him,

83.text:
And so he selected a group of ten and they
were carrying heavy boxes of ammunition

91.text: and trying to get across this open ground.

93.text:
They managed to find a stream that kept them
slightly concealed.

97.text: There was a lot of bombs going off and mortars.

100.text: There was a lot of smoke and a lot of confusion, which to an extent helped them.

105.text: And they managed to get a reasonable way across.

107.text:
But then they were discovered 
and the German machine guns

111.text:
and the other guns were 
brought to bear on them.

115.text:
And sadly the majority of them died before
reaching the forward trench.

121.text: And then I think with one box of bombs -

123.text:
I can't remember how many 
bombs were in the box -

126.text:
but my grandfather and two others 
managed to reach the trench.

131.text: One of the men died in the trench.

137.text:
And through that, in reinforcing 
that forward position,

140.text:
they managed to hang on to 
their bit of the trench.

145.text:
Part of delving further into the whole action,
my grandfather's history,

154.text: being able to see a re-enactment today,

157.text:
has given me a real feeling of... 
not necessarily being there,

161.text:
but more of a feeling of how 
the group acted together,

166.text:
finding out a little bit more about 
the Sikhs that were involved.

169.text:
And, you know, the re-enactment, 
we're here now,

173.text:
the bits around it as well in terms of how
men would have been living,

177.text:
how they cooked their meals, 
it's just brought it all together.
